{"step_by_step_thinking": "After flap surgery, the soft tissue tooth interface that forms in a previously denuded area is known as the junctional epithelium. This is a specialized type of epithelium that forms a seal between the tooth surface and the surrounding soft tissues. It is characterized by a shallow attachment to the tooth surface and a high turnover rate. The junctional epithelium plays an important role in maintaining the health of the periodontium.", "answer_choice": "A"}
